parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Failure of ZAP to Comply with NHTSA Recall Order
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of ZAP to comply with the NHTSA recall order has resulted in owners being unable to drive their vehicles, facing insurance and registration issues, and experiencing financial losses.
symptoms: Owners have not received payment or communication from ZAP
despite submitting required paperwork and meeting deadlines. Vehicles are sitting idle
and owners are facing local code violations.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake system can cause accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the brake pedal sticks to the floor
the brake pedal does not return to its normal position
the brake pedal has a delayed return to its normal position
the brake pedal has a sudden loss of pressure
the vehicle is unable to stop.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Failure of ZAP to Repurchase Vehicles with Defects
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: ZAP's failure to repurchase vehicles with defects as ordered by NHTSA can lead to continued operation of unsafe vehicles, potentially causing accidents or injuries to drivers and passengers.
symptoms: Vehicle owners have not been contacted by ZAP to arrange for payment and/or pickup of defective vehicles
despite the company's agreement to do so; ZAP continues to advertise and sell defective vehicles on online marketplaces without adequate disclosure of the problems.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: ZAP's failure to disclose defects in their vehicles can lead to unsuspecting buyers purchasing unsafe vehicles, potentially causing accidents or injuries to drivers and passengers.
symptoms: ZAP continues to advertise and sell defective vehicles on online marketplaces without adequate disclosure of the problems; vehicle owners are not informed about the defects and potential safety risks.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Failure to Comply with Recall and Buyback
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the manufacturer to comply with the recall and buyback program has left vehicle owners with worthless vehicles that cannot be insured or registered, causing significant financial loss and inconvenience.
symptoms: Vehicle owners are unable to insure or register their vehicles
and recall refunds have not been processed.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The insufficient braking performance of the vehicle can increase the risk of accidents, injuries, and fatalities, as well as lead to financial losses and legal liabilities.
symptoms: The vehicle takes longer than expected to stop
the brakes feel soft or spongy
the vehicle is unable to stop quickly enough to avoid accidents
the brakes are unresponsive or fail to engage.
